channel.title: Comments on: Professional Development Week, An introduction to this week on SQL University
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Shannon Lowder
item.dc:creator: Shannon Lowder
item.content:encoded:
“Most of all how do we truly become advanced beyond our standings and know we still has further to go?”

For me the way I’ve grown throughout my career is never settling for ok. I know there is always a better way to do something, or a better implementation of something I’ve built.

This really kicked in a little over 6 years ago. I worked in a shop where if a report finished in under an hour it was good. That wasn’t good enough for me. I knew they could be better. I pushed myself to learn indexing. I pushed myself to learn SSRS. That constant drive to be better, every day, is what keeps me going.

I know I’ll be at this until the day I give up being a database professional. But when that day comes, hopefully I’ll have transitioned into a teacher, a leader, a resource, for helping others apply this same technique to their career.

item.dc:creator: chopstik
